Created an attachment (id=25127)
the XML file used to replicate the problem

just open it within eclipse, add a section and tryto save it.
This looks like our document from WTP in this stack trace.

Feng, I've tried with out latest build from WTP (an I-build from 7/21) and I do
not see a performance problem just saving the file. And, we've fixed some of
those types of NPE in the log you provided an example of. Which build are you on? 
Mind trying on a recent build? (We whould have RC2 out on Friday, 7/22, and we
are one week away from our 0.7 release, so quick feedback would be VERY helpful). 

But, I'll admit, I do not really know what you are doing in your SpecialSaveAction. 
If it is a small change, should be no problem, but there (still) known
performance issues with things like trying to format the whole document.

Neither do I, David.

May be some plugin is doing all the mess. I am using Lomboz 3.1M6, Andrei 
Loskutov's AnyEdit plugin and NRG Javascript Editor.

Ah, I see now that comes from the "any edit" plugin. 
You might enter a bug there too?
Maybe they'd have some insight or some plans to test co-existence?

I did not fill a bug there, but I upgraded the AnyEdit plugin from version 
1.3.1 for Eclipse 3.0 to 1.3.4, the problem has gone.

Ok, thanks Feng. Based on your comment 6 I'll assumed this has been fixed, but
since I don't know specifically what was fixed, will mark as "worksforme". 

Let us know if you find other problems or other "bad interactions" with other
plugins.
Marking as verified just to signify correctly categorized.

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
